page.title: 19FARMING:DAIRY
page.content: Dairy farming in the area consists of 3 small farms all coming under the control of Oak Farm. One section of the farm. covers 80 acres, mainly used as pasture for a herd of Fresians, a few sheep and turkeys kept for Christmas. Another section covers an area of 55 acres used for grazing cattle. This farm has 68 Fresian cows and 21 younger stock. They have a number of farming machines including 3 tractors, baler, mower and turner. Mr. H. Lewis of Oak Farm was interviewed and stated his family had been farmers for only 5 years. He is pleased with the facilities, machines and land, and does not consider moving as he likes the area. The farm buildings are old brick-built facing onto the road leading into Drayton Bassett village.
